dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 5256 IH: To direct the Attorney General to acquire data, for each calendar year, about sexual offenses, including rape, that occur aboard any mode of transportation over which the Federal Government exercises jurisdiction.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Crawford (for himself and Ms. Norton) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To direct the Attorney General to acquire data, for each calendar year, about sexual offenses, including rape, that occur aboard any mode of transportation over which the Federal Government exercises jurisdiction.

section.header: Statistics relating to sexual offenses that occur aboard any mode of transportation over which the Federal Government exercises jurisdiction
section.text: Under the authority of section 534 of title 28, United States Code, the Attorney General shall acquire data, for each calendar year, about sexual offenses, including rape, that occur aboard any mode of transportation over which the Federal Government exercises jurisdiction (including aircraft, any vessel of the United States or which travels in interstate or foreign commerce or within the admiralty and maritime jurisdiction of the United States, any vehicle used or designed for flight or navigation in space, and any vehicle which travels via any facility of interstate or foreign commerce), disaggregated byâ€”

paragraph.text: the mode of transportation aboard which the offense was committed; and
the location of the commission of the offense.
